result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J. Brilowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No objection for transferring to Portage County
Concurrent with: each other

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE/schooling and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours community service per week.

No contact with E.S. and D.S.  

Absolute sobriety from alcohol.

AMENDED
May travel to the Dominican Republic for the dates of Feb 20, 2016 up to Feb 29, 2016.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

AODA and any follow up.   DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: to Temporarily Modify Judgment of Conviction. (stj)

Case called: 2:30 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Jared Redfield;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct. 3 (DC)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, on each count, concurrent. CONDITIONS: No Contact with E.S. and D.S., Abolsute sobriety from Alcohol, AODA and any follow up, Restitution in the amount of $50 to be paid, Good Faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. No objection for transferring to Portage Co.

Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, on each count, concurrent. CONDITIONS: No Contact with E.S. and D.S., Abolsute sobriety from Alcohol, AODA and any follow up, Restitution in the amount of $50 to be paid, Good Faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. No objection for transferring to Portage Co.

Adjourned: 2:40 pm

Pre-trial conference at 12-16-2015 10:10 am.
Final pre-trial at 01-13-2016 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial at 02-17-2016 09:00 am.

Shall not consume alcohol. Absolute sobriety from alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents.   No contact with victim(s): E.S. & D.S. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
